FuncDef:
The radius-server type command sets the RADIUS version used between the device and a RADIUS server.
The undo radius-server type command restores the default configuration.
By default, the RADIUS version is standard.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that RADIUS of the standard version that based on relevant standards is used between the device and the RADIUS server. This version is used to set a standard server.
-

Indicates that RADIUS+1.0 is used between the device and the RADIUS server.
RADIUS+1.0 is a Huawei private RADIUS protocol, compatible with the early versions in which the standard vendor-ID is not defined. For the RADIUS attributes supported by this version, see "RADIUS Attributes" in the Feature Description - User Access.
-

Indicates that RADIUS+1.1 is used between the device and the RADIUS server.
RADIUS+1.1 is an extension of relevant standards, supporting more Huawei private RADIUS attributes. For the RADIUS attributes supported by this version, see "RADIUS Attributes" in the Feature Description - User Access.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the device connects to a RADIUS server, run the radius-server type command to set a RADIUS version. RADIUS attributes vary with versions of the RADIUS protocol.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
